div.p: Each request includes one or more detail elements that specify what is being ordered. The following kind of orders can be made:

tr.td: Local work flow arrangements will determine whether the laboratory handles a request by waiting for a specimen, or for the patient, or by visiting the patient directly to obtain the specimen (i.e. phlebotomy ward round)
Transfer of care from one practitioner to another

div.p: Note that a resource may only be used for the order details if the resource type explicitly defines how it is known to be something requested, as opposed to (for instance) something that has happened. For some resources, such as a prescription, this is defined to be always true, while other resources may have some kind of status element for this purpose. If the resource type does not explicitly define this, then it cannot be the target of an order.
